result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Christopher Mahr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron Christopher Mahr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron Christopher Mahr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 30 days to pay.
Court dismisses Count 2.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Christopher Mahr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for payment on July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Bill. Filed by Atty Demaio. km    EJL approved 6/17/15. c: Def & ks. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA & HPD. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio, DF: Aaron Christopher Mahr appeared.  Court called at 10:15 a.m. Set out for PTC.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Guilty plea is entered.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

- Court suspends the fine and orders court costs only of $243.00
- Court grants 30 DTP
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Order for payment on June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
DE mailed copy this date. jaf
From JA to parties. Re: appointment of counsel. km
For ATTY FEES.   DE to pay $60/mo comm 5-01-15 (May pymt pd today).  DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty.  DE will be mailed an Order for Pymt. jaf
EJL appointed Atty Daniel DeMaio and signed 5/4/15. eif

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 29, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski for today only,  DF:  Aaron Christopher Mahr appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 11:30 am.
